articles.author: JILL COLVIN and AMANDA SEITZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President-elect Donald Trump announced Thursday he will nominate anti-vaccine activist Robert F.
articles.title: Trump chooses anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as health secretary

articles.author: MICHELLE R. SMITH
articles.description: Long before the COVID-19 pandemic, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was building up a following with his anti-vaccine nonprofit group, Children’s Health Defense, and becoming one of the world’s most influential spreaders of fear and distrust around vaccines.
articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has a long record of promoting anti-vaccine views

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump spent much of his first term feeling stung and betrayed by those he’d placed in power. This time, he’s not taking chances.
articles.title: As he fills his new administration, Trump values loyalty above all else

articles.author: AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: LIMA, Peru (AP) — President Joe Biden arrived Thursday in Peru to start his six-day visit to Latin America for the final major international summits of his presidency, even as world leaders turn their attention to what Donald Trump’s return to the White House means for their countries.
articles.title: Biden arrives in Peru for international summit and meeting with Xi as world leaders brace for Trump

articles.author: SEAN MURPHY
articles.description: The purchase of Alex Jones ' Infowars at a bankruptcy auction by the satirical news publication The Onion is the latest twist in a yearslong saga between the far-right conspiracy theorist and families of Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting victims.
articles.title: How Alex Jones' Infowars wound up in the hands of The Onion

articles.author: JIM GOMEZ
articles.description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Typhoon Usagi swamped rural villages in floods, knocked down power and displaced thousands more people before blowing away on Friday from the northern Philippines, which has now been pounded by five major storms in less than a month.
articles.title: Typhoon Usagi wreaks more damage and misery in Philippines as yet another storm looms

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Human Rights Watch says Israel is committing war crimes and crimes against humanity in the Gaza Strip, including massive forced displacements that amount to ethnic cleansing of Palestinians from parts of Gaza.
articles.title: Middle East latest: Human Rights Watch accuses Israel of war crimes in Gaza Strip

articles.author: ROD McGUIRK
articles.description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — How do you remove children from the harms of social media? Politically the answer appears simple in Australia, but practically the solution could be far more difficult.The Australian government’s plan to ban children from social media platforms including X, TikTok, Facebook and Instagram until their 16th birthdays is politically popular.
articles.title: Australia's plan to ban children from social media proves popular and problematic

articles.author: MARIA SHERMAN
articles.description: Juan Luis Guerra 4.40 took home the album of the year trophy at the 2024 Latin Grammy Awards for his “Radio Güira,” not long after receiving record of the year for “Mambo 23.”
articles.title: Juan Luis Guerra 4.40 wins album of the year at the 2024 Latin Grammys, a 25th anniversary party

articles.author: SCHUYLER DIXON
articles.description: ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) — Friendship is at the heart of how a fight came together between 58-year-old former heavyweight champion Mike Tyson and much younger YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul.
articles.title: Mike Tyson concedes the role of villain to young foe in 58-year-old's fight with Jake Paul
